com.gembox.spreadsheet.conditionalformatting

Class TopOrBottomRankedCondition

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gembox.spreadsheet.conditionalformatting.FormatCondition
      • com.gembox.spreadsheet.conditionalformatting.TopOrBottomRankedCondition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.gembox.spreadsheet.internal.styles.CellFormatDataFormatHolder

    public final class TopOrBottomRankedCondition
extends FormatCondition
    Represents a condition that formats only cells with top or bottom ranked values.
    See Also:
    Excel Conditional Formatting example

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FormatConditionType getConditionType()
      Gets the FormatConditionType.TOP_OR_BOTTOM_RANKED value.
      int getRank()
      Gets the number or percentage of top or bottom ranked cells which are formatted.

      Gets the actual formatting which will be applied to a cell if its value satisfies this TopOrBottomRankedCondition.

      Gets a value indicating whether to format cells with bottom ranked values.

      Gets a value indicating whether the rank value is expressed as a percentage of a number of cells in the applied range.

      • isBottom

        public boolean isBottom()

        Gets a value indicating whether to format cells with bottom ranked values.

        Default value is false (formats cells with top ranked values).

        Returns:
        true to format cells with bottom ranked values; otherwise, false.

      • isPercent

        public boolean isPercent()

        Gets a value indicating whether the rank value is expressed as a percentage of a number of cells in the applied range.

        Default value is false (the rank value is expressed as a number of cells).

        Returns:
        true if the rank value is expressed as a percentage of a number of cells in the applied range; otherwise, false.

      • setBottom

        public void setBottom(boolean bottom)

        Sets a value indicating whether to format cells with bottom ranked values.

        Default value is false (formats cells with top ranked values).

        Parameters:
        bottom - true to format cells with bottom ranked values; otherwise, false.

      • setPercent

        public void setPercent(boolean percent)

        Sets a value indicating whether the rank value is expressed as a percentage of a number of cells in the applied range.

        Default value is false (the rank value is expressed as a number of cells).

        Parameters:
        percent - true if the rank value is expressed as a percentage of a number of cells in the applied range; otherwise, false.

      • setRank

        public void setRank(int value)
        Sets the number or percentage of top or bottom ranked cells which are formatted.
        Parameters:
        value - The number or percentage of top or bottom ranked cells which are formatted.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Value is less than or equal to zero.

        public String toString()
        Returns a String that represents this TopOrBottomRankedCondition instance.

        This method should be used primarily for debugging purposes and should be considered volatile (format of its return value might change in future versions).
